subject: Writing
title: Ethos: The Power of Credibility
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Ethos: The Power of Credibility.

hook.text: You'll believe a doctor about health and a chef about food â€” not the reverse. That's ethos at work.

buildup.text: Ethos is the persuasive appeal based on the speaker's character, credibility, and trustworthiness.

discovery.text: Aristotle said ethos is often the most effective appeal â€” we're persuaded by people we trust, not just arguments.

twist.text: Ethos can be manufactured. Celebrity endorsements work even when the celebrity knows nothing about the product.

climax.text: In the age of misinformation, ethos is both our best defense and our greatest vulnerability.

punchline.text: We don't just believe words. We believe the person saying them.
